content.webTitle: Eurotunnel undermined by ferries and airlines

fields.headline: Eurotunnel undermined by ferries and airlines
fields.bodyText: Channel tunnel operator Eurotunnel showed the continuing effect of tough competition from low-cost airlines and cross-channel ferries yesterday, reporting third-quarter revenues up just 1% to £141m. The number of lorries using the tunnel fell 2% to just under 300,000, while the number of cars rose 1% to just shy of 610,000. Coach traffic leapt almost 35% to 19,500. Eurotunnel, which is still trying to thrash out a deal to reduce its £6bn debts, saw revenues from shuttle services gain 1% to £77.9m but revenues from train operators using the tunnel were unchanged at £58.7m.
